resources.string: A German philosopher, cultural critic, composer, poet, philologist, and a Latin and Greek scholar.
Actor, film director, martial artist, martial arts instructor, philosopher, and founder of the martial art Jeet Kune Do.
Chinese communist revolutionary who became the founding father of the People\'s Republic of China.
Inventor, electrical engineer, mechanical engineer, and futurist who is best known for his contributions to alternating current.
Theoretical physicist who developed the theory of relativity, one of the two pillars of modern physics (alongside quantum mechanics).
